alert.note: Alert for Cleveland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:16AM EST until January 11 at 2:49AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Broad River In NC At Boiling Springs affecting Cleveland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River In NC at Boiling Springs. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The Broad River is flooding residential yards and affecting foundations near Abe`s Mountain Rd. The Broad River Greenway is experiencing flooding of low-elevation trails and picnic areas along the river. Floodwaters may be impacting local campgrounds near the river as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EST Wednesday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 3.0 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 07/08/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
